ygData.subject: Tani's Loss
ygData.msgSnippet: Sorry to hear about this Wendy.  Its amazing how few people like this it takes to ruin GM events and make people paranoid about losing their hard won
ygData.messageBody:
Sorry to hear about this Wendy. Its amazing how few people like this it
takes to ruin GM events and make people paranoid about losing their hard won
treasures. Glad to hear you're still upbeat after it though, doubt I would
be so charitable.

Another funny thing is seeing how many people won't change the subject line.
Not that you're an idiot by any stretch, just an optimist, which is a good
thing to be. Almost makes me wish I had kept playing my original bard on
Sol Ro just so I could help you out.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 02, 2000 8:20 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] <-------idiot


From: "Cranfill, Wendy" <Wendy_Cranfill@...>

Hello everyone :)

Well I just wanted to tell you a little tale so that you can all remember
not to make my mistakes. Last night, I made the mistake of consenting
someone to drag Tani's corpse out of the Scryer room in Guk. Well, long
story short, all my armor and weapons were stolen (punishment for twinking,
heh) by this guy.

There are all sorts of complicating sidelines to this story which I'll spare
you. Although I know it was always a risk, I just never thought someone
would be so mean and viscious. The items are just items, but people that do
that stuff just plain suck!

Guess I'll have to make a contest to see how much of my quest stuff I can
get back in one week.

Hope you're all having a great day... and DON'T CONSENT SOMEONE YOU DON'T
KNOW!!!
(most of you have probably figured that out - guess I get to wear the naive
banner for the week)

Tani 20th nekkid Bard
Halana 50th Shamana
Solusek Ro


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
